intro: Arrabidaea sanctae-marthae, commonly known as the São Tomé starling tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of São Tomé in the Gulf of Guinea. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces striking yellow and orange flowers that attract various pollinators, including birds and insects. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
